channel.title: Should I? I think I should
channel.description:
Well, the guy who I sold my Uncalled Attack project to wants me to take it back, it's ranked 8th on RuneLocus and he's using some leeched source with just about nothing added to it. But because it's ranked 8th on RuneLocus I want to take it back, but I'm having second thoughts about taking it back because it's a leeched source with only 1-2 things added on, but I could always make more updates to it. I just want your opinions, but the leeched source it's using is some DSPK source, but again, I just want to let you remember that it's ranked 8th on RuneLocus getting over 100 everyday, also getting like $70-$210 in donations everyday. So what do you guys think I should do, I'll probably take it back. He's already used one of my methods for vote rewards, so there's one thing added on that's not in DSPK. So, again, what do you think I should do?
The reason he's giving it back to me is because he says: "It's just getting way too large for me to handle, I'm overwhelmed in the success, and honestly I can't handle it all."

item.title: Should I? I think I should
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:19, topic:386209”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=481967.msg3531400#msg3531400 date=1300209113]

Good job. Taking it back seems to be the right decision. I’ll take it any day if you’re through with it too. ;D
[/quote]Haha, I don’t think that’ll be necessary :), but the server’s pretty good so far, no exploits found or anything. So, awesome, glad I took it back.

Make me co-owner plz?[/quote]Are you serious? I hope not, you have to earn it.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I? I think I should

item.title: Should I? I think I should
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

How would he scam me? I’d move the entire server source from his 4GB VPS single-core processor into my 7GB dedicated server duel quad-core processor. Then I’d put his IP on my watch-list [a notepad of IPs to look out for in case he does try to scam], and plus I’ve already told a guy this, whom I’d make an administrator, that developed his own C# program that lets him into that person’s computer so he’ll protect me and my server. I’m pretty much safe.

Read full topic
